name: Bufo
Relationship: Compare: Baryt. carb.; Asterias; Salamand. (Epilepsy and softening of brain)Complementary: Salamandra.Antidotes: Laches.; Seneg.

Heart: Sensation of heart swimming in water
Eyes: Cannot bear sight of brilliant objects
Modalities: Better: from bathing or cold air; from putting feet in hot water
Head: Face bathed in sweat
Sensation as if hot vapor rose to top of head
Epistaxis with flushed face and pain in forehead, better, nosebleed
Numbness of brain
Female: Palliative in cancer of the mammae burning in ovaries and uterus
Menses too early and too copious, clots and bloody discharge at other times; watery leucorrhoea
Skin: Pustules, suppuration, from every slight injury
Bullae which open and leave a raw surface, exuding and ichorous fluid
Extremities: Pains in loins, numbness of limbs, cramps, staggering gait, feeling as if a peg were driven in joints; swelling of bones
Male: Involuntary emissions; impotence, discharge too quick, spasms during coition

details: Of use in feeble-minded children. Prematurely senile. Epileptic symptoms. Convulsive seizures occur during sleep at night. More or less connected with derangements of the sexual sphere, seem to come within the range of this remedy. Injuries to fingers; pain runs in streaks up the arms.Acts on the nervous system and skin. Uterine symptoms marked. Lymphangitis of septic origin. Symptoms of paralysis agitans. Striking rheumatic symptoms.Arouses the lowest passions. Causes a desire for intoxicating drink, and produces impotence.
